index.title: AntelopeJS Nuxt : Bootstrap Template
text: This codebase is a concrete example of an optimal NuxtJS configuration with Bootstrap-vue, Color-mode, Pug, Sass, Vuelidate, ParticlesJS, AOS, SweetAlert, Gmaps and nuxt-property-decorator. Our database automatically activates HTTP/2.0 in production (under https only) via a custom patch. The entire development environment is also preconfigured for Visual Studio Code with EsLint, StyleLint, CommitLint and Prettier modules which will allow you to check and format your code in real time while writing it. It also includes a sample integration of I18N with NuxtJS, the standard for multi-language website translation, to make it easier for you to create realistic websites as required by today's standards.

This base includes all boostrap-vue documentation in Pug format (optimized and intuitive markup), examples of Particles.js (a common effect on many websites that gives a pretty cool technological effect) and examples of AOS (Animated On Scroll) for easy to set up animations on any elements in your theme.
For your information, this database was used to create the AntelopeJs.io website and documentation as well as the AntelopeJS framework dashboard.

structure.title: Base structure:
structure.text: Only the particularities of our configuration are detailed in this summary, for the rest the standards of a nuxt project are kept, you can find them on the official website of nuxt.
subtitle: The Assets File:
The I18N File:
The Layouts File:
The Components File:
The Pages File:
The Static File:
subtext1: The css folder contains the css file(s) containing the css variables to make it easier for you to multi-theme your website (default/dark/etc.).
The img folder contains the images used to make your template and not the images intended for your content, which will need to be in the "./static/img" folder.

The scss folder contains the boostrap-vue configuration files (breakpoint, font size responsive, component color, etc.) as well as your main.scss file which will be the main stylesheet for your project.
subtext2: The folder contains the json files containing the translations of your static texts.
subtext3: The folder contains the layouts of your website by default the main layout (default) and the layout of the error page (error).
subtext4: The folder contains components used in multiple places in your template, usually components used multiple times in your layouts and pages.
subtext5: The folder first contains a "_lang" folder to avoid having to create "en", "fr", etc. folders and duplicate all your pages for each language, our i18n configuration automates the process of creating the multi-language urls for your site from this folder.

The "_lang" folder then contains the folders for your pages, each page folder automatically ignores the "_components" folder it contains from the nuxt "supercharge" (non-interpreted at the routing level) to allow you to place there the components used only by that page and thus avoid overloading the "./components" folder the initial architecture of nuxt.
subtext6: The "img" folder contains all the graphic elements used in the content of your pages (and not the design elements, which should be put in the "./assets/img/" folder).
The "js" folder contains your javascript files from your favorite libraries.
The root of the folder also contains your files whose names should not change during the build such as favicon, robot.txt, etc.

bootstrap.title: Bootstrap-vue
text: With BootstrapVue you can build responsive, mobile-first, and ARIA accessible projects on the web using Vue.js and the world's most popular front-end CSS library — Bootstrap v4.

With more than 85 components, over 45 available plugins, several directives, and 1200+ icons, BootstrapVue provides one of the most comprehensive implementations of the Bootstrap v4 component and grid system available for Vue.js v2.6, complete with extensive and automated WAI-ARIA accessibility markup.

particles.title: Particles.js
particles.text: tsParticles - Easily create highly customizable particles animations and use them as animated backgrounds for your website. Ready to use components available for React, Vue.js (2.x and 3.x), Angular, Svelte, jQuery, Preact, Inferno.

aos.title: Animate On Scroll
aos.text: AOS is a CSS driven scroll animation library useful to animate elements on any website while the scroll is going on. It works in any direction either while scrolls down or up.

gmaps.title: Nuxt-gmaps
gmaps.text: Add and customize easily your Google maps with this package for Nuxt.js.
